title: 9/26/23 Senate Study Committee on Foster Care & Adoption
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia Senate Study Committee on Foster Care & Adoption session:

## Overview
This session focused on discussing the impact of adverse childhood experiences (ACEs) on the foster care system. There were presentations from experts at the National Conference of State Legislatures on ACEs and their connection to foster care, as well as discussions around prevention and policy considerations.

## Key Actions
No bills were passed or referred during this session.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced.

## Notable Moments
- The committee acknowledged the absence of several members due to illnesses, hospital visits, and other commitments. 
- The committee welcomed representatives from the Department of Human Services, Lieutenant Governor's office, Senate Press, Senate Research, and Legislative Council.
- Juvenile court judges were also recognized for attending and providing valuable input.

## Votes
No votes were recorded during this session.

## Attendance
A quorum was present, though several committee members were absent due to various reasons.

## Adjournment
The session adjourned, and the next meeting was scheduled for October 26th in Columbus, focused on adoption.
